channel.title: How-To Geek
channel.description: We explain technology. Learn more with our articles, reviews, tips, and the best answers to your most pressing tech questions.

item.title: Nintendo's 1995 Virtual Boy Is Now a Switch 2 Accessory
item.dc:creator: Arol Wright
item.content:encoded: The Virtual Boy, back in 1995, is known by most people as Nintendo's first big blunder. It was a sort of cursed VR headset released before modern VR headsets became popular, but it was a commercial, bug-ridden failure. Now, it's back—as an accessory to a modern console.

item.title: Fedora 43 Beta Is Almost Here, and the Wallpaper Just Dropped
item.dc:creator: Jordan Gloor
item.description: The countdown begins for this space-themed beta launch.
item.content:encoded: Fedora Linux developers just announced that the Fedora 43 beta is confirmed to be coming next week. Tuesday, September 16, 2025, is when we can expect to see it available for download. Fedora releases always come with a new default wallpaper, and the one for this week also just got finalized.

item.title: How to Use the TOCOL and TOROW Functions in Microsoft Excel
item.dc:creator: Tony Phillips
item.description: Turn your complex 2D data into straightforward 1D data.
item.content:encoded: Reshaping a two-dimensional array of data into a single column or row in Microsoft Excel streamlines the layout of your figures and makes for more efficient sorting and filtering. For these reasons, you should get to know how Excel's TOCOL and TOROW functions work.

item.title: From Plex to Pi-hole: The Software That Made My Homelab Feel Complete
item.dc:creator: Patrick Campanale
item.description: It's taken years, but my homelab finally feels complete.
item.content:encoded: I’ve been building out my homelab for nearly half a decade. It's involved many iterations; from hardware to software the makeup of my homelab has all changed many times over the years.

item.title: Get 27% Off This Galaxy Book 5 360 Laptop With a 15-inch Screen Today
item.dc:creator: Corbin Davenport
item.description: A great price for a high-end convertible PC laptop.
item.content:encoded: If you need a new Windows laptop with enough space for all your work, look no further than the Samsung Galaxy Book 5 360. It’s a 2-in–1 convertible laptop with a 15.6-inch screen on sale for $987, a discount of 27% from the original price of $1,350.

item.title: Google is Pulling Its Weather App on Wear OS Smartwatches
item.dc:creator: Joe Fedewa
item.description: Why is Google so weird about weather apps?
item.content:encoded: Google has a weird history with weather apps. Pretty much every phone comes pre-installed with a weather app, but for a long time, Google simply didn't have one. However, it did have a weather app that any Wear OS smartwatch could install. That app is going away, and the replacement is not straightforward.

item.title: The Best Boomboxes of 2025
item.dc:creator: Joy Okumoko
Kris Henges
item.description: Do you miss the humble boombox? Well, they never went away, and they've never been more feature-packed.
item.content:encoded: The original boomboxes offered one of the first ways to bring music anywhere. We've got plenty of options for portable music now, but a boombox brings more than that, with plenty of features, playback options, and volume.

item.title: Apple Watch Will Tell You if You Have Hypertension
item.dc:creator: Jorge A. Aguilar
item.description: It may not be a doctor, but it's getting pretty close.
item.content:encoded: Apple has officially received FDA approval for a new hypertension notification feature on its Apple Watch that’s rolling out next week. The best part is that you won't need to buy a new watch to get it. The feature is coming with the watchOS 26 update.

item.title: Why the New iPhone Takes Better Selfies Than Your Android
item.dc:creator: Tim Brookes
item.description: Coming to an Android phone near you.
item.content:encoded: While a lot of fanfare has been made about the iPhone’s new 48 megapixel rear-facing camera sensors, the front-facing shooter might be just as significant of a change, even if you don’t take a heap of selfies.

item.title: Linux Mint's Debian 13 Upgrade Is on the Way
item.dc:creator: Jorge A. Aguilar
item.description: Linux Mint Debian Edition (LMDE) is getting a new foundation, and Mint 22.3 is coming soon.
item.content:encoded: The Linux Mint team has explained the roadmap for their next major release, the Linux Mint Debian Edition 7 (LMDE 7), codenamed "Gigi." The regular edition of Linux Mint will stay on an Ubuntu base, but LMDE 7 will soon use the latest Debian 13 release as its foundation.
